name: Engenni

sentences: ọ kịnono/kịnono ậno
kịnono
ọ nwạ́sesè/nwạ́sesè ậno
nwạ́sesè
ọ ạvùràmù/ạvùràmù ậno
ạvùràmù
o amemùrè/amemùrè âno
amemùrè
o edèì/edèì âno
edèì
o ozyí/ozyí âno
ozyí
ọ ạmò/ạmò ậno
ạmò
o wuese/wuese âno
wuese
edèì wei ga o gbúnonò ạmò
The man said that he will heal the child
edèì wei ga ó gbunono ạmò
The man said that he did not heal the child
edèì wei ga ò gbunono ạmò
The man said that he healed the child
edèì wei ga ọ nwạ́sesè ạmò
The man said that he will frighten the child
edèí dhiá wei ga ọ́ nwạsese ạmò
The evil man said that he did not frighten the child
edèí dhiá wei ga ọ̀ nwạsese ạmò
The evil man said that he frightened the child
edèì wei ga ọ kị́nonò ạmò
The man said that he will resemble the child
edèì wei ga ọ́ kịnono ạmò
The man said that he did not resemble the child
edèí dhiá wei ga ọ̀ kịnono ạmò
The evil man said that he resembled the child
ạvùràmú dhiá wei ga o gbúnonò amemùrè
The evil woman said that she (someone else) will heal the girl
ozyi âno wei ga o wúesè opilopo
This thief said that he (someone else) will kill the pig
okàà âno wei ga o wúesè ozyí kofilomù
This old man said that he (someone else) will kill the coughing thief
ạmò wei ga òki kị́nonò amemùrè
The child said that he (the child) will resemble the girl
ạmò ậno wei ga òki nwạ́sesè ozyí lẹlemù
This child said that she (the child) will frighten the deceived thief
ạmodhyòmú nụamù wei ga òki gbúnonò okàà âno
This beaten youth said that he (the youth) will heal this old man.
ozyi âno wei ga òki wúesè amemùrè
The thief said that he (the thief) will kill the girl
opilopó nụamù wei ga ọ kị́nonò ạmò ậno
The beaten pig said that he (someone else) will resemble this child
edèì âno nwạ́sesè ozyí lẹlemù à?
Will this man frighten the deceived thief?
ạvùràmù kịnono amemùrè ânò à?
Did the woman resemble this girl?
amemùré dhiá kịnono opilopo ânò à?
Did the evil girl not resemble this pig?
ạvùràmú kofilomù wei ga o gbúnonò ạmò.
The coughing woman said that he (someone else) would heal the child.
ozyi wei ga òkí gbunono okàá nụamù ậnò.
The thief said that he (the thief) would not heal this beaten old man.
ạmodhyòmù wei ga ò wuese ạvùràmù.
The youth said that he (someone else) killed the woman.
ạmó gbunono amemùrè ânò à?
Did the child not heal this girl?
ozyí nụamù wei ga ọ̀ kịnono ạmò
The beatened thief said that he (someone else) resembled the child.
edèì âno nẉạ́sesè ozyí lẹlemù à?
Will this man frighten the deceived thief?
edèì ânò wei ga òkí nwạsese ozyí lẹlemù.
This man said that he would not frighten the deceived thief.
ạvùràmù kịnono amemùrè ânò à?
Did the woman resemble this girl?
ạvùràmù wei ga òkì kịnono amemùrè ânò.
The woman said that she did resemble this girl.
ạmó lẹlemù ậnó wuese ạvùràmù à?
Did this deceived child not kill the woman?
ạmodhyòmù wei ga ò wuese ạvùràmù.
The youth said that he did kill the woman.
edèí dhia gbúnonò ạmò à?
Will the evil man heal the child?
ạvùràmú kofilomù wei ga o gbúnonò ạmò.
The coughing woman said that he would heal the child.
amemùré dhiá kịnono opilopo ânò à?
Did the evil girl not resemble this pig?
ạvùràmù wei ga ọ́kịnono opilopo ânò.
The woman said that she did not resemble this pig.
ozyì gbunono okàá nụamù ậnò à?
Did the thief heal this beaten old man?
ozyì wei ga òkí gbunono okàá nụamù ậnò.
The thief said that he did not heal this beaten old man.
ozyi âno kị́nonò edèí kofilomù à?
Will this thief resemble the coughing man?
ạmò ậnò wei ga ọ́ kịnono edèí kofilomù.
This child said that he would not resemble the coughing man.
edèì ânò nwạsese ozyi à?
Did this man frighten the thief?
amemùrè wei ga ọ̀ nwạsese ozyi.
The girl said that he (someone else) frightened the thief.
amemùré lẹlemù wúesè ạmodhyòmù ậno à?
Will the deceived girl kill this youth?
amemùré lẹlemù wei ga òki wúesè ạmodhyòmù ậno.
The deceived girl said that she(the girl) will kill this youth.
ozyi ânò wei ga ạmó gbunono edèì.
This thief said that the child did not heal the man.
okàa kị́nonò ạmodhyòmú kofilomù ânò à?
Will the old man resemble this coughing youth?
ạmò wei ga ọ́ kịnono ạmodhyòmú kofilomù ânò.
The child said that he (someone else) would not resemble this coughing youth.
ạvùràmú nụamù ậno nwạsese edèì à?
Did this beaten woman not frighten the man?
ạvùràmú nụamù ậno wei ga òkí nwạsese edèì.
This beaten woman said that she (the woman) did not frighten the man.

note: The language belongs to the Benue-Congo family. It is spoken by approx. 20,000 people in Nigeria.The mark . underneath a word's frst vowel indicates that all of the word's vowels are pronounced with a slightly lowered tongue. The marks á, à, and â indicate high, low, and falling tone, respectively; if none is present, the syllable has middle tone. You can interpret all negative forms in this puzzle as negatives in past tense. (did/would not)
